thread.title: High school roundup: Olivia Miranda leads Bethlehem girls' soccer to win - Times Union
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Olivia Miranda leads Bethlehem girls' soccer to win - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Olivia Miranda leads Bethlehem girls' soccer to win - Times Union
text:
Bethlehem sophomore Olivia Miranda scored the lone goal of the game in the first half and lifted the Eagles to a Suburban Council girls' soccer win over Guilderland on Thursday at Bethlehem Central High School .
Bethlehem improved to 7-5-2 overall and 6-4-2 in Suburban play. Guilderland dipped to 7-4-1.
Miranda's goal was her seventh of the season. Sophia Calabrese provided the assist.
Miranda Manziano stopped six shots and earned the win in goal. Taylor Dorado made nine stops for Guilderland.
More girls' soccer: South Glens Falls junior Gabrielle Kreppein scored a pair of goals to help the Bulldogs down Amsterdam 4-0 in a Foothills Council matchup. Elyse Green earned the win in goal and stopped five shots. South Glens Falls improved to 9-4 overall and 8-1 in league play.
Boys' soccer: Bethlehem scored three goals in the second half and defeated Guilderland 3-1 in Suburban Council action. Eddie Yu provided Guilderland a 1-0 lead at halftime, but Luke Dole leveled the game in the 58th minute. Three minutes later Pat Hynes gave the Eagles (10-3, 10-2) the lead for good, 2-1, and Noah Weinstock scored the final goal with nine minutes left to play. ... Thomas Seeberger scored six goals and added two assists as Loudonville Christian crushed Heatly 10-0 in a Central Hudson Valley League game.
Boys' volleyball: Mitch DeBortoli totaled 11 kills and Shenendehowa swept Saratoga Springs 25-15, 25-17, 26-24 in a Suburban Council match. Tom Hurley and Dylan Urbanski combined for 27 assists for the Plainsmen (10-3 league).
Girls' volleyball: Sisi Sorriento had seven aces, seven kills and nine digs to lead Troy over Albany, 26-24, 25-21, 12-25, 25-16. Maddie Brown added five kills and four digs for Troy. Essence Pringle had 24 kills and eight blocks and Bridget Whelan added 13 digs for Albany.
